title: Maidencombe Walk Route

images.title: Paul Hutchinson / Cliffs at Maidencombe
images.caption: Cliffs at Maidencombe. Looking past the beach cafe, closed at this time of the year, lie the red sandstone cliffs to the north side of Maidencombe beach.

images.title: Watcombe Bottom from Watcombe Plain by Des Blenkinsopp, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons

images.title: Derek Harper / Oddicombe Beach from Babbacombe Downs
images.caption: Oddicombe Beach from Babbacombe Downs. Hard to resist taking a picture of this celebrated view on a glorious summer's day. Beyond the beach is Petitor Point in SX9266, followed by the cliffs and inlets heading north to Teignmouth at the extreme right.

images.title: Roger Cornfoot / The football stadium at Babbacombe model village.
images.caption: The football stadium at Babbacombe model village.

images.title: Derek Harper / Outbuildings at the Courthouse, Maidencombe
images.caption: Outbuildings at the Courthouse, Maidencombe

description: This pretty coastal village sits justs to the north of Torquay in Devon. The area is still largely rural making it a fine place for a walk away from the busier parts of Torbay. This walk from the village takes you south to visit Watcombe Beach and Oddicombe Beach. On the way there's some wonderful red sandstone cliffs and some classic local views from the high points. The walk starts from the car park next to the beach where you can pick up the South West Coast Path and follow it south to Shackley Beach, Watcombe Head, St Marychurch and Oddicombe. It's an interesting area with the rare Babbacombe Cliff Railway which will take you down to the secluded beach. There's also the Babbacombe Model village and some fine cliff top views to enjoy here.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: The Thatched Tavern is a splendid place for some post walk rest and refreshment in the village. The historic inn dates back to the 17th century and is set in a low-ceilinged picture postcard thatched house. Inside there's a cosy interior with a log fire for winter days. Outside there's the tranquil landscaped gardens to enjoy on warmer days. You can find them on Steep Hill at postcode TQ1 4TS for your sat navs.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: The John Musgrave Heritage Trail starts in the village. The long distance trail will take you to some of the historical highlights of South Devon.

display_address: Steep Hill, Maidencombe, Torbay, England, TQ1 4TS, United Kingdom
